description: Great spot to watch the game or PPV UFC & boxing. They have SEC network & show most of the NCAA games. They also have Sunday Ticket for all the NFL Football. Truvia is at 9 every Monday night, Karaoke at 9:30 on Tuesday nights  & live music every Thursday at 10 pm. Try the Bloody Mary's, Old Fashioned & Manhattans.
author: Thomas M.

description: My girlfriend really enjoyed our visit to Blackthorn on a Saturday afternoon. We stopped by after strolling through Golden Gate park. The beer selection is pretty good. Some beers are rare and priced a bit too high for my taste. Which you might say that I should not order it. However, if the price was listed along with the pour size of the beer then I would not have ordered it.
author: David F.

description:
Came by with a friend to watch some college football, and it wasn't the best experience in the world.  We ordered a pitcher during happy hour and it came out to $23 before tip, which was kind of pricey for what it was.  When we were walking around later we saw many neighboring bars had much better deals at around $12/pitcher.  

The beer we got wasn't that great either.  I had to check the menu at one point to make sure we didn't order a non-alcoholic drink because our beer was so watery and light.  

In addition to this, the bartender wasn't the most friendly or welcoming, and she told a few of our friends who joined us later to leave.  

Overall, this bar will definitely have the sports you want to watch, but they have subpar drinks at really high prices.  Their happy hour isn't really a happy hour in my opinion, and the service was okay at best.  Will definitely be trying out some other places in the area as alternatives.
author: Tim L.

description:
FU! We got judged at door.... stupid bouncer .. we just got off work ,. He probably thought we were drunk..., stupid MF.. told bar tender to serve us water..  go to hell ..   I've spent $$$$ over the years .. no more .. we went to another bar close by..
FU!!!!
author: Demanding T.

description: I am giving three stars because overall our experience here was fair. My cousin and I each had a beer and the service was decent. But, the tone of our experience changed when the dark haired female Irish bartender asked my cousin to remove his sunglasses because "sunglasses aren't allowed." He proceeded to respectfully explain that they are prescription sunglasses and that he didn't have regular glasses with him and wouldn't be able to see without them. If we had already finished our beers we would have just left right then, but we were only about half way done. He squinted his way through the rest of our visit to Blackthorn. We will not be returning. I was shocked at this policy considering that he needed his glasses to see. The policy was not explained at all and we left immediately after finishing our drinks. I've noticed in other Yelp reviews that Blackthorn has some inconsistent and sometimes sketchy policies so good luck if you visit this bar.
author: Samantha B.

description:
I finally got to check this place out last week and stumbled upon a great live band. The lead singer was amazeballs and just did the best rendition of killing me softly, when really she killed the whole bar with her voice.

They have a decent beer list with that has cute names like "Karl the Fog". Lots of TVs, so this place is packed during Warriors games. They even have a small back patio area with tables and benches and a heater to keep you warm.

Super fun place and will come back!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Since Stephanie S. and I had some time to kill before dinner with our friends, we headed over to Blackthorn for happy hour! This sports bar/pub has happy hour from 12pm -7pm on the weekdays. $1 off drinks, $4 draft beer, and free pool.

Bartenders are nice, so it's not a bad place to drink and chill at. It seems like a great spot to catch sports games though!
author: Christine S.

description:
This place was cool, parking can be a real pain in the butt. Luckily I rode in with a scooter to park in such tight spaces. I was visiting my friend in SF.

Decor: typical bar, there were pool tables there, but they cover them up im assuming only during games. (niners, giants, etc)

price: i have no clue because it was my birthday and i didn't drop a dolla.

parking: Parking is DEF not the greatest, you have to look through the neighborhoods in order to find decent parking. It's 2 hour parking

verdict: I mean if you are coming to watch the home games for SF, you are going to get that feel of the home team. (talking like i am from out of town, because i am. ha)
author: Ernest M.

description:
To the general manager of the store, shame on you for putting a pit bull breed restriction at the bar. We were told that an unfortunate incident had happened in the past with the breed and now you're putting a label that all pit bulls act that way. I'm sorry, that's not good enough of an excuse for me. Are you to say that if a golden retriever starts a fight, will you put a restriction on that breed too? 

We live in SF and we frequent this bar many times as it's become one of our favorite places to watch the Warriors and Niners. Sadly, we won't be coming back. My dog gets stereotyped for his breed and I blame the media and close minded people more than anything, but I will NOT support establishments that discriminate.
author: Maria V.

description: Good bar. My friends and I dropped in on a Saturday night post-dinner. The place had a good number of people but wasn't crazy packed. We were able to grab a booth. There are plenty of reasonably priced drinks - beer, wine, whisky, and cocktails - including a selection of barrel aged cocktails. Staff is nice. Pool tables were opened so didn't have to wait to play.
author: Judy C.

description:
My bartender "FRASER AK" sucked major balls. Do NOT go to this establishment.

He made me wait unnecessarily long when the bar was obviously not busy TWICE: over 5 minutes to even acknowledge my presence at the bar upon arrival and therefore take my drink order and an additional 10 minutes (AT LEAST) when I came back to close out my tab.

I don't know what his deal is but FRASER AK needs to be replaced. WORST customer service ever. I've never felt more ignored and quite honestly disrespected anywhere in the entire country. Busier bars in NYC, CHI, Miami, and LA won't even make anyone wait this long... MANAGEMENT NEEDS TO REPLACE HIM OR RETRAIN HIM.

Did not enjoy my visit. Will not come back. Hate writing negative reviews but it would be a major disservice to not warn my fellow Yelp patrons of horrible customer service.
author: Noy R.

description:
Living in the Inner Sunset, so far this is my favorite bar. They have really good prices for the area, along with a super long happy hour. The place has a nice vibe, pool tables, good music and will let you bring in your own food. Last time we brought in a whole pizza. 
Bottom Line: Awesome classic bar with good prices.
author: Amanda S.

description: Nice place but bartender was counting my drinks like I was a child, and was very condescending about it. I was not sober but I was, also, not doing anything. Would not go back, better to go to the Mucky Duck where you aren't judged.
author: Brynne M.

description: Fun place went on Monday and Wednesday pool night. Had a good time. And a great patio
author: Nicey S.

description: Came on a Sat afternoon and people watched with a cold brew.  A nice place for a heated patio.  Nice music and bartender are friendly.  A great place to have Sat afternoon chill in the city
author: Larry C.

description: NOT DOG FRIENDLY AS ADVERTISED. Been here half a dozen times before w my dog. Decided to bring a group of friends in here specifically because we had a dog. Was told "Suzie The Manager said no dogs today" which is a pretty s---y thing to do ie changing rules on the fly for no reason. We went down the street and gave our eventual $500 bar tab to someone else. It's an ok bar otherwise and I don't like writing negative reviews but that was a rude experience. Do better.
author: Peter R.

description: I had only been in this place maybe four times.  It has always been in the early afternoon and was my first stop.  I never had any bad experiences, always just had one cider or wine and left.  I never had any conversation or interaction with anyone except one of the Irish bartenders, a very nice brunette.  On my last visit (and it will be the last), there was a blond Irish woman bartender.  I don't recall meeting her before, I greeted her politely and she responded politely.  Then, much to my total surprise, she informed me that she could not serve me.  I thought she was kidding.  Upon inquiry, she said there was an "incident".  News to me, so I asked for some details.  She had no info, was not witness to any incident, and was quite vague as to when this occurred or what this incident involved. She first said that it was "last week or maybe two weeks ago" (I was in Alaska during that period). I told her I was not going to argue with her, but told her I think there must be some mistake and I left.  Seeking clarification of why I was not being served, I sent an email asking for clarification as it was clear that there must be some mistake.  I did not get the courtesy of a response.  I have been a long-time customer of their other bar, The Cabin on Polk, since they opened quite a few years ago.  Never any issues.  Won't return there now either.  I am 67, retired, respectful, non-violent, mind my own business, etc.  WTF?
author: Gary M.

description:
Walk in order a drink and stand at the bar, the bartender keeps looking at me weird. I go to the restroom, come back to the bar to order another drink and the bartender refers me to another who says you're bothering my bartender. WTF?? I haven't said 2 words to her, I say close me out and I'll leave. I'm a bartender at Crustacean, come see me and I'll show you service and hospitality!! Daphne from Scooby Doo is not a bartender but an order taker. Back to bartending/personality school you go...OH I teach there!!
I just moved to the neighborhood and have been exploring the neighborhood!! 1st mistreatment!! Other bartenders I've met there have been awesome and welcoming!! Ursela is a Rock Star!!
author: F G.

description: The bouncer is an idiot. 20 of us came to hang out and he didn't let one of our friends come into the bar so we went to little shamrock instead. Bouncer insisted our friend was drunk although she was clearly sober.
author: Conor C.

description: Went here to get a couple of drinks while waiting for dinner at San Tung. Great environment, awesome pool tables, and quality service and pours. I'd come back here even if I wasn't waiting in line for dinner
author: Nicholas C.

description: Every time I come in Jessica makes the whole experience lovely. She remembered my name and favorite drink even after only one introduction. It is comfortable here and the back patio is an added bonus. Great music too! And I never yelp.
author: Sally T.

description: Tried to go here last night to play some pool, but the bouncer wouldn't let us in b/c he said we were too drunk.  We asked him why he thought that and all he had was "there are a lot of drunks out today" (it was SantaCon day).  We even tried to introduce ourselves and shake hands but he still wouldn't let us in.  We moved on and had a good time at Mucky Duck.
author: Mike Y.

description: Went on a Tuesday night...the bartender lady can't make a decent cocktail to save her life!! Rude af too. The bartender guy was nice tho hence the one star
author: Jason W.

description: This was my go-to bar for years when I lived in the inner sunset. I enjoyed its relaxed atmosphere, generally good beer list and the fact that takeout/food was welcome, of which there is plenty from good restaurants nearby.
author: Mary B.

description:
This spacious bar has plenty of seating for multiple groups, billiard tables, and tons of TVs to watch sports games. I love this place. I came here for Monday Trivia Night with some friends, and it was very well-orchestrated. Good variety of questions with different rounds, including a music round and picture round.

The selection of beer is good, although they do not serve food... only bar snacks. Thoughtfully, they have binders of to-go menus so you can order from restaurants around the area. How nice! During one of the breaks in the trivia night, I left the bar to grab Mexican food and came back. On the night that I played, our team won several drink tickets from getting 2nd place. Woohoo! I totally did not contribute many answers, but it was fun nevertheless.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Came to this bar awhile back to watch a golden state warriors game. I was surprised they actually put the sound on for most of the game. I'm used to trying to read the subtitles as fast as I can. Of course, majority of the people in the bar were rocking their warriors gear. (Bandwagoners.... jk haha) 

It also happened to be trivia night. Which means... People get into groups and create a team name. The M.C. asks questions about current events, pop culture, etc. and after all the questions have been asked you switch papers with another group and grade it. Whichever team gets the most right wins a prize. My team didn't win. (Probably because we were watching the game at the same time) 

We ordered some drinks, which were not too expensive and tasted pretty good. (That means a lot coming from me since I don't really drink alcohol) My friends and I ended up ordering food from pasquales which is up the block and ate it at this bar. (We probably aren't supposed to do that but whatever) The bar was super crowded after trivia and since the game was still going on. Good thing one of my friends stayed to save our table. 

Blackthorn is a nice neighborhood bar. There are a few pool tables near the back where the bathrooms are. There are lots of flat screen tvs above the bar area. The leather chairs are comfortable. Great for watching Bay Area sports teams or just grabbing a drink. The bartender I interacted with was very friendly. I would definitely come back again.
author: Mariah V.

description: Little hidden patio in the back. Amazing draft selection, cool bartenders and a chill neighborhood vibe. Cheers.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Cool, fun sports bar vibe. Watched a big Warriors game here and it was crowded, but it was still a fun spot to have a few drinks and chill with friends. Drinks came at a decent time too, seeing that the bar was packed to the max.

Key point though is to arrive early for those big games, otherwise you can't get it, it happened to me on a different occasion, but makes sense due to maximum capacity.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place is a great bar and establishment. They have wifi, amazing music, and a solid drink selection. It's a perfect place for staying warm on a cold winters night. Good neighborhood too.
author: Priyanka W.

description:
This is a great bar to watch any game or sports match/tournament. I have been here a few times to watch martial arts tournaments. It has become somewhat of a tradition. It's free to watch some games! Really popular fights obviously charge cover. 

They don't serve snacks here but what's great about Blackthorn is that they allow you to bring outside food and enjoy it there. They even offer plates, napkins,  forks, etc. when you do. Once you're done they're quick to clean up after you. 

They offer their cocktail drinks in little Mason jars. Real cute and hipster. I ordered their cucumber cocktail on the menu. It was very refreshing as well. I really like this place. It is very spacious and doesn't stink like Yancy's Saloon. They could use bigger TVs or lower them. When you sit for a long period of time and have to sit well belong the screen,  it hurts your neck after a while. I experienced this after the Rousey v Correia fight. It was very crowded and they added a lot of extra seating that night with $10 cover. 

Come here if you want to relax and watch a game! Bring your pizza and enjoy a few beers!
author: Lyra C.

description:
Blackthorn. One time during high school cross country practice my male friend and I were running on the track with the cute, fast sophomore (Abby) because she was a superstar and was the same speed as us at the time and she ran behind us so that we could protect her from the wind or maybe we were just faster than her but okay the punch line is that my cross country coach joked that she was the rose while my friend and I were the thorns. 

We walk into blackthorn to catch the Warriors game. There's always at least one open table inside. The leather chairs are super comfortable. No cover either. There are a mixture of hotties and bust chicks. The dudes' demographic leans toward the cool California bro type. That's fine with me, despite never having been to Tahoe or "the lake" to hang out on a boat. 

My friend gets us two beers, and they're fine. I don't know. He finished my beer because I had enough to drink prior to this point. It gets loud in here.
author: Jerry B.

description: Cold beers great sports on the tv's and excellent service from Thomas behind the bar. Extremely clean and we'll kept with a great atmosphere. Definitely recommend this place for locals and out of towners.
author: Michael B.

description:
Blackthorn is a decent hang-out spot in the Inner Sunset.

The place is big and there's always plenty of room to sit and move around.

I appreciate the outdoor patio, which even has some outstanding heat lamps overhead to keep you cozy on chilly nights. Unfortunately there's not a ton of ventilation out there - and most people are smoking cigarettes - so the crisp air always ends up being followed by coughing.

Mucky Duck and Irish Shamrock are two of my preferred spots in the area- but Blackthorn is well worth checking out - if you want ample sitting room, if you enjoy playing pool, and if you're looking for a warm smoking area.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This is my favorite bar in Sunset. Mellow environment, nice booth-type tables, good music, nice tv's, an outdoor seating area, and 2 pool tables. You can even bring your own food! Happy Hour is great (Mon - Fri 12-7pm), there are rotating beers on draft - $1 off drinks, and select draft beers are $4, and pool is free during HH. 

Best of all, the bartenders are wonderful! I actually lost my phone here recently. It was a long shot, but I came back to ask if anyone happened to turn it in. One of the guys went to the back, brought out his laptop and let me sign in to iCloud so I could find my phone. My phone was turned off and I was devastated. The guy took down my number and told me he would look at the security cameras in the morning and notify me of the news- good or bad. I am completely amazed and appreciative that he went the extra mile to help me find my phone and surprisingly someone did return my phone! Amazing customer service! I will be back, again and again!
author: Kelli H.

description:
Read my tip!

I walked in here after class, looking for a cold beer. 
They have a fully stocked bar, and a bunch of great beers on tap. They have tons of TVs to watch any (US-mainstream) sports. I didn't see any cricket, and it's not soccer season I think, not sure they air tennis here. I don't really follow sports, but there was college basketball, NBA, UFC, and a bunch more. 

The bartender Susie? was super attentive, but a bit busy running things on her own. The bathroom is kept clean. There is a billiards table in the back, and a pinball machine. Seating is plentiful, so it's good for groups!

I was drinking a pitcher of boont amber ale on my own (which set me back 17 dollars), and I got hungry. They have small backs of chips, but that's about it. I was advised to bring in my own food from the neighboring restaurants!

I saw a review about bringing dogs in, and here's some clarification when I asked about it:
Handheld dogs are allowed, but much preferred during the day. They prefer dogs be kept at home at night. What happened was, they used to allow dogs, until somebody complained, and so they had to change the rules. So while dogs are technically allowed, they have to be small, and you have to be able to carry it.

Definitely awesome vibes here. I'm sure I'll be back sooner than later! Maybe i'll come back for Monday night trivia, which is free.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
Nice low key neighborhood bar. Fairly good selection of beers on tap, fair prices and nice staff. What more can you ask of a bar? It's not too loud or crowded so you can chat with your friends while enjoying some drinks and not yell your head off. 

There is a pool table and the music isn't too overwhelmingly loud. From what I could tell there wasn't much line or competition for the pool table. 

They also serve food here but I didn't end up trying it. Maybe next time. I'd definitely come back if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Laima K.

description:
IMO, I much prefer this place than Yancy's Saloon a few blocks up. 

This place has a great romantic dim lighting, multiple TVs for all types of sports, pool tables, arcade games.... the list goes on. You can honestly bring any type of hang out here. Date night? Perfect room ambiance. Reunion? Get a game of pool goin'. Cheering for a fellow sport team? You're in the perfect place.

My friends and I were back in town for a week, so we decided to check out the bars in San Francisco. We came on a Tuesday night and the bar was pretty much empty. No big games going on, so it's was quiet and relaxing.
The bartender was suuuuper nice and attentive. She cracked jokes with us and discussed personal favorite drinks to recommend. Plus, she was super fast and efficient with the drinks. What an awesome bartender!
Personally, my fav was the Blackhorn Punch cocktail. Yummmm. The Cucumber Quencher was really sour, I wouldn't recommend it if you're not into sour candies and such.
author: Jenny C.

description: Great atmosphere, nice bartenders, Good drinks, good time! I'm definitely coming to this bar again.
author: Hailey L.

description:
BThorn is a great local bar to get your drank on and have a fun time.

Such a generic thing to say, but the Thorn has never done me wrong. The memories of hanging out with friends is obviously the part that endears me to Blackthorn, but there's a lot to like about the place.

The staff is nice, the place is clean, and there's plenty to do to keep your entertained. Pool table? Check. Lots of TVs? Check. Tons of seating (indoor and outdoor? Czeck! 

A good time is had by all (unless you're a miserable person, then you should probably just stay home)!
author: Crystal C.

description:
For a multitude of reasons, Blackthorn is the perfect tavern for those with short attention spans:

1.  A large collection of TVs simultaneously airing the World Cup, the A's, the Giants, and some new drama with the sound set to mute.  

2.  Tired of your seat at the bar?  How about moving to a table?  Don't like that table?  How about a move to the outdoor patio in back?  Still antsy?  Play some pool.

3.  Can't get into walking your dog today?  Take her here and she won't tell a soul.  (Dogs are welcome until 7 p.m.).  

4.  So ADD that you can't focus on what to wear?  Anything goes here.  I walked in on a Friday night clad in a down vest and flip flops and fit right in.  

5.  Nobody with a short attention span wants to stand three deep at a bar trying to get the tender's attention.  Despite a sizable crowd, people weren't bellied up to the bar nor 3-deep.  Walked up, made eye contact, ordered and got my drink then put it on repeat.  

6.  With a short span of attention you'll not want to deal with parking here anytime before normal dining hours have passed.  On Friday night around 10 p.m. there were 3 available spots on Irving in the same block as Blackthorn.  Shhh, don't tell.  

Blackthorn is the quintessential neighborhood bar but if you don't live nearby and find yourself passing through it's a worthy place to throw a few back.  Even if you don't think you're dressed for it, have your dog with you, and really want to watch the A's game.
author: Tracey A.

description:
Situation 
- Meeting friends for drinks a few times and watching UFC

Pros
- The bartenders (and staff) are friendly and provide good service
- Credit cards are taken
- There's a pool table 
- There are a good amount of TVs
- A decent amount of beers on tap 
- A good amount of seating

Cons 
- The bathrooms could probably be a tiny bit nicer
author: Dipesh G.

description: Worse service I ever had!! The skank bartender actually cursed at me Because I had the balls to order a drink..fat chick with a back Tattoo... Do yourself a favor Blackthorn and get rid of this girl...attitude is disgusting
author: Martin D.

description:
I'm visiting from Brooklyn and my friend works closely this bar so we thought it was a good option.  While we were in our lyft to the bar, our driver mentioned that it was an 'interesting bar'. We arrived and paid for multiple drinks while attempting to play pool a couple of times on empty tables, but employees claimed they were 'up next' and 'of priority' so we waited. When we were finally allowed to play, right after we bought a round of drinks and put in money for the game, the bar yelled at us that they were closing in 5 minutes. With little respect they monitored our actions and were very aggressive about getting us to leave. Overall it seemed like customers were not a priority.  

Yes, go here to watch sports and to experience verbal abuse - but if you're looking for a good time skip this bar and go elsewhere.
author: Rachel L.

description: Very much a regulars bar..for happy hour anyway.  If you're not a "regular" white dude, be prepared to wait a while for a weak drink.  While you wait you can listen to terrible ZZ Top and Van Halen....Blackthorn is a little piece of the suburbs in the inner sunset but it serves many.  Just be aware.
author: M L.

description:
After years of working in the Inner Sunset, this Inner Sunset drinky spot is hands down my favorite. Let me tell you why:

- KARAOKE TUESDAY is super fun! Stay away if you don't like crowds, though, it usually gets pretty packed! The more drunken bad singing, the better.

- LOADS of TVs. Great for sports. And this is a sports town, how 'bout that.

- It is not halfway as smelly/sticky/musty/crusty as Mucky Duck or the Little Shamrock.

- IT TAKES CREDIT CARDS (boo, Yancy's).

- They have pool AND pinball! *Thumbs up*

- It's the only place I've found my beloved Hell or High Watermelon on tap around here... am I not looking hard enough?

- Huge comfy booths nice for collapsing in with your work crew after a long day at the office.

- Friendly bartenders! One thing I will say I do not like though, is that say, you may order a particular shot of something on one day, and have it be $6, and you'll be like, "wow, that is a great price for that particular shot!" And then a couple days later you'll go and order another round of that same whiskey or whatever and suddenly it'll be like $8-9 each... wtf? It's happened to me on separate occasions already. I usually just suck it up and pay whatever they're asking on the day sans complaining, but I just wish there was a little more consistency.
author: Theresa C.

description:
I hate one-liners, but:

Pool tables + drinks served in Mason jars... what more can I say.
author: Edna C.

description: I liked this place...came here for a before dinner drink. Typical sports bar with a large array of liquor to choose from and at a decent price. Lots of seating, tvs and the whole spread. Many people were sitting directly at the bar. Great for groups, singles and the like. I'd definitely come back.
author: Guisela L.

description: chose this place because it was dog friendly, once in the bar then bartender came up to us and said no pit bulls allowed. I get it people have a fear, but it was we discriminating, our dog was happy and excited to be there, no aggression at all. Also dogs can't be there after 7.
author: Julee M.

description:
Environment: Great place to just hang out and chill.   The place has two pool tables so that's always an option.  The bar selection is good! 

Customer service: great! The bartender was friendly and helpful.  Drinks were great!  

Would definitely recommend!
author: M R.

description: Fun place. The main concern is it is super loud in the evening, basically you need to scream to have a conversation.
author: Clark S.

description:
INSANELY loud and the bartenders are very unfriendly. I'd be unfriendly too if I worked here, but it's not the place you should go if you want a somewhat mellow time-- or want to hear your friends at all. Their drinks are good and prices are decent. 

On the up side, their patio is nice, but that space gets snatched up fast.
author: Cecilia A.

description:
Watched the 49er's game against the seahawks at the Blackthorn. We were lucky enough to get seats at the bar and order various tap beers and their bloody mary. Bloody mary was a bit too peppery and spicy for my liking but it was still delicious. All of their tap beers were delicious, but one that stood out the most was the chain breakers white ipa. seriously delicious - i'd highly recommend it. 

all in all, great experience. Bring your own food as well!
author: Sung K.

description:
The bartenders were attentive. This may have been because the people I went with are frequent customers. I was able to get the type of wine that I wanted & my friends got what they wanted & all for a discounted price. My wine was satisfying and was just what I needed for a relaxing Sunday evening. I can tell the people who work here are really friendly & do a great job of making sure you feel comfortable. We just missed the rush of people here who watched the 49er playoff game. Luckily, we did because I was told it was super crowded. We sat outside at one of the tables beneath a heat lamp. 

As for the ambiance, it was quite dark like most bars I've been too. They had a pool table & supposedly, a pool league which is amazing. It looked like a lot of the locals take part in that. You also get to meet some new people which is always a lot of fun. There is also an arcade game in the corner. They have a single restroom for men & women. Unrelated to the bar, there was an incident with an impatient woman who was clearly inebriated. She kept knocking at the door & rudely asked me to hurry up when I just got inside the restroom. I was not happy with her attitude. Other than that, I still had a pretty good time & plan on being back!
author: Brittany D.

description:
This used to be a quiet bar where you could meet Irish expats and sometimes hear Irish music.

Now, it has been transformed into a loud sports bar with multiple TVs and blaring music.

It is a shame what has happened here.

I advise you to head elsewhere.
author: George B.

description: $15 cover on a Saturday afternoon  for UFC? Meh go around the corner for beers instead
author: Jonathan S.

description: One of the better bars in the Sunset that has really improved a lot since I moved here.  They have a really solid always expanding lineup of beers, good bartenders, and generally a friendly vibe.  If you like to shoot pool - this place is the best.  They have two tables and always keep them open from 4 to 7 during happy hour so I often stop by after work to shoot a few racks.  It does get really crowded on game nights and some week nights for trivia and Karaoke which can be a plus or minus depending on the day, but it's good to have the option.
author: Paul W.

description:
PROS:
- Monday night trivia. Fun but my very AZN friends and I decided the questions were geared towards white people. Especially the music rounds.
- BYO food
- Tried a really good cider.. should really find out what my friends ordered..

CONS:
- Must get there early on Trivia night! The earliest in our group arrived at 8:45pm for 9pm Trivia and we got stuck at the lone table at the very end of the bar past the pool tables. We had to deal with a) not enough chairs for everyone and b) pool players constantly jabbing their sticks into our faces (though they were polite about it).
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Wow.  Now THIS is a sports bar.  They've got around a dozen screens playing ALL THE GAMES at once and they've got some spirited fans packed in here.  When our hero popped in to imbibe a few brews and watch some Sunday football, there were girls ordering mimosas alongside bros shouting "RIP HIS HEAD OFF" at the screen.

For only 5 to 6 bucks a pop, the beers here are quite reasonably priced.  The staff is quick to take your order as well, and our hero's glass was never empty.

PROS:
- Good variety of seating from a long bar to cozy booths to outside patio spots.
- Decent number of beers on tap and a full bar to boot as well.
- Games like pool and arcade games available as well.

CONS:
- Most of their beers are of the macro variety.  You wont exactly find Pliny the Elder or Drake's 1500 on tap here.
author: Albert W.

description: This is my neighborhood spot, not just because of its proximity to my home but because of how comfortable I feel grabbing a drink at Blackthorn. Extremely legit staff; they are friendly and attentive and have become good friends. Very legit selection of drinks for great prices. And the patio in the back is my favorite. Can't praise this place more as the go to for a casual night at the pub or to watch a warriors game. There's also a to go menu available with all the local food spots you can order from and take back to Blackthorn. Really can't go wrong with this place.
author: Rob C.

description: Place was packed on Friday night. Drinks are recently priced. Liked that they played hip hop there, which was very unexpected. I didn't stay there for long to get the full experience though. Music was a bit too loud in my opinion.
author: Cathy N.

description:
A really excellent selection of brews on tap. Good mix of your average macrobrews and rotating craft brews. Typically $4/pint for Happy Hour and $5/pint normally. Standard. What makes Blackthorn stand out is the awesome atmosphere. This is my go-to tavern for a night of simplicity and no-frills drinking and catchin' up with friends. The interior is very spacious. There are pool tables. You can bring your own food. There are numerous, big-screen HD TVs broadcasting live sports and sports news. Level of pretention: NONE. 

I love Blackthorn and I will miss it when I move out of San Francisco.
author: Dan K.

description: Good spot for UFC fights, usually $15 cover.
author: Inigo M.

description: Great place to keep up with just about every game with good beer. Bartenders a little cold.
author: John P.

description:
Highlights
- Awesome neighborhood bar if you want to kick back and catch up over some beers with friends. 
- Two pool tables. $1 each game and it only takes quarters. 
- They serve 21st amendment watermelon beer complete with a watermelon wedge for your glass. My fav! 
- Plenty of TVs to catch the latest sports game. 
- I came on an off day on Sunday evening and it was perfect. Not crowded, plenty of bar/booth/or regular table seating, and even a patio for smokers. 

Improvements
- None really, this is a solid casual watering hole.

Tip
- Parking in this area can be hard to find. Metered and neighborhood spots only.
author: Tracy T.

description:
This has been my neighborhood bar for over 15 years. I have known 5 prior owners, however I do not know the newest owner. 

I watched football there yesterday, so I was there for about 3 hours. My friend's Sierra tasted like dish soap, so she brought it back (full.) The owner gave her the 3rd degree about it, asking her questions like, "Maybe the other bars you go to have bad Sierra and you are comparing it to ours? Maybe their lines are bad and you are used to bad beer?" He finally agreed to give her a new one, but with this last protest, "I will do it just this once." Oh, THANKS! Nice customer service, guy.

When I signed out, I did not include my tip on the card because I wanted to give the tip to the only guy that helped me: The Bearded Bartender who couldn't have been nicer. The owner and another bartender (his cousin?) were having words about me when they noticed I didn't leave a tip. I waited for the Bearded One to come back from his break and handed him his tip in cash. 

This morning, my statement shows that the Blackthorn charged me a tip anyway! I had to call my bank and fill out a claim to get it removed. I did try calling the bar first, but I decided I really didn't want to deal with the owner.

I will be sticking to the Fireside from now on.
author: Tink K.

description:
Blackthorn has become my boyfriend and I's go-to spot for Niners games this season.  The people that come to Blackthorn are really fun to watch football with if you're a Niners fan. It gets loudddd. It can get really busy here but they have a ton of TV's so you'll have a good view of the game from anywhere you sit in the bar. I've only come on Sunday's but they're always playing a lot of other football games in addition to the Niners game which means I can keep up with my fantasy team while watching my home team at the same time!

The bartenders are really nice and funny and they have some great beers on tap. You're also allowed to bring in food from anywhere which is pretty cool and convenient.
author: Alli Q.

description:
Since Yancy's has been our group's go-to spot, Blackthorn is uncharted territory and we've never ventured here until recently although we must have walked past by countless times.  I felt a bit guilty as if I was cheating on Yancy's the very day, May 3rd 2013, but I have to say it was quite an pleasant surprise that I've stumbled upon to this gem.

5/3/13 First encounter - came to Blackthorn unexpectedly on a Friday night while the Giants were playing and they had a promotion with Blue Moon in which every glass you buy, you get a Giants/Blue Moon Tumbler!  how cool is that?! As a Giants fan, any free Giants gear is a win since they can be quite expensive! Since we popped in on the way home to say hi to a friend, I made a mental note to come back next time.  

5/7/13 Second encounter - The following Tuesday, my bf and I had dinner around the area so we decided to drop in and catch the rest of the Giants game before we head home.  I purposely ordered a Blue Moon thinking that I would get a free tumbler.  I was quite disappointed when the waitress informed us that it's only a promotion they run on Fridays..however the promotion on Tuesdays when the Giants are playing is the raffle of 2 tickets to an upcoming home game.  WHAT?! Did it just get better?!  You get a 1 ticket into the raffle with every drink you buy so drink up!  I'm pretty bad luck when it comes to raffles (I don't think i've ever won anything) so I told myself it's probably gonna be bad seats anyway.  After the game had ended, they started the draw and announced that the tickets were BOX seats!  SHUT UP!  It did just get better!
author: Mandy L.

description: Excellent neighborhood sports bar. The staff is friendly, but not in the overly annoying way that grinds my gears. The patio out back is super awesome and full of neighborhood regulars that are always down for good conversation. 10/10 would visit again.
author: Ben C.

description: Good bloody Mary's (as good if not better than Finnegan's), there's a patio, and it's right next door to Perilla. In fact, you can even eat your Perilla in the bar. Pretty much the best place to nurse your hangover ever.
author: Sarah W.

description: This is my watering area, I rotate between Mucky, Yancys, and Blackthorn. Blackthorn has tons of TVs, decent beer selection, watermelon wheat from 21st Amendment, pool tables, Irish bartenders, chill outside area with a TV, and last but not least they are one of the few bars in SF that play PPV UFC and boxing fights. UFC fights tend to run $10 and boxing $10-20. They also allow outside food. Grab a beer, a whiskey shot and order some dry fried wings from San Tung (walking distance) BOOM!
author: Nick L.

description: Live a few blocks away, hang out in bars often, and still only come here a couple of times a year.  Tends to be crowded, loud, and a very young crowd.  Never really as felt like a bar where you'd ever become a regular at.  There's plenty of people in the neighborhood that love this place, but for my drinking dollar you'll instead find me around the corner at the Mucky Duck, or further down Irving at the Silver Spur.
author: Joshua W.

description: Good fresh drinks, dog friendly, bring your own food is a nice option for a beer at lunch time. Lots of variety in tap beer. Bartenders can be a little in attentive. Trivia is fun
author: Heather H.

description:
I'm waiting for the chance to come here and experience it in all it's glory. As in, I'm waiting to come here where they is a game on TV and watch it with a nice cool beer.

Blackthorn is nice with its leather couches, multiple tables, huge television screens, and more. Additionally, they have a good variety of beers on tap and the prices are pretty good. Not to mention, a pinball machine in the corner, pool tables, and an outside patio. Definitely a place worth visiting.

(Holy crap, I just read what I wrote and sounded like a complete advertisement)
author: Jessica H.

description:
Pretty great place to get some beers and watch the game. Like other bars in the sunset, they allow outside food so even if its at a time before acceptable drinking hour, go in, have a glass and enjoy some food from a number of great restaurants nearby. Bartenders are friendly as well and always gets your drinks promptly. The outside terrace in the back is great for smokers and would recommend midafternoon on a sunny day. 

Also, they take card, so if you don't feel like having to pay cash every time (nothing against yancy's, but sometimes I dont want to walk to the bank after a few beers), its a nice bar to drink at. And bar trivia is great. But seating is limited so come as soon as possible if you want seats.
author: Cody M.

description:
This was stop number one for the Sunset Pub Crawl on ClueKeeper. It seemed like a nice neighborhood bar with a few locals hanging out playing pool in the afternoon. The happy hour lasts from noon to 7 pm weekdays and includes pitchers! 

I'm not sure how crowded it gets at night, but during the day there were plenty of tables and booths, and free wi-fi. Overall, they are a "sports" bar, but they seem pretty nerd-friendly as well, with trivia night, board game night and the ClueKeeper puzzle / trivia pub crawl.
author: Patricia H.

description:
Great local Sunset bar if you're looking to watch the UFC or another sporting event.

Gets extremely crowded and the door feee for the events its a little ridiculous, $10 a person. Decent selection of beer, could be better... 

You can get any of the local places that deliver to bring you food too.
author: Brett H.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: parking in the area during dinner time sucks. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: clean. Chill. I like how there is a pinball machine. Younger crowd. Not uncommon to see a backpack. A bunch of TVs. I really like this bar. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: alcohol

_____

Overall Experience

3/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

Alcohol
author: Elliott N.

description:
I used to come here much more frequently when I lived a block away, but its still fun to go back! The staff is super awesome. Joe is great. He even gave me some coconut water with my bloody mary when I was really hungover. 

Drinks are fairly cheap, and you can order/bring in food from any of the fantastic restaurants nearby. They even have menus in the bar so that you can call in an order without having to leave. They show all the UFC fights, and it gets super crowded, so get there early. It's great for sporting events too. 

Greatest neighborhood bar in my opinion.
author: Lauren D.

description: I like this place!  It's laid back, and just has a good vibe.  They don't have food, but they allow you to have food delivered to the bar or you can bring food in.  We will go back for sure.
author: Sarah S.

description:
They allow small dogs as long as:
- They are quiet and well-behaved
- It's not too crowded

Nice!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Every time I come here, I forget you can bring your dog..... So...every time I see a dog in here, I'm like WTF a dog in a bar, that is so Awesome.

A great selection of brews on tap, I've been on the IPA hype lately, Lagunitas never lets me down.

They have two pool tables.

Comfy booths for all your booze chuggin friends and a nice outdoor patio.
author: Brendan C.

description: Just moved down the block and finally made my way to this dive bar on a Tuesday night. Which was karaoke night. Really chill crowd, great bartenders. They have magners. And trivia Mondays. I'm gonna be a regular.
author: Vivian H.

description: Pleasant atmosphere with lots of TVs = great for viewing of sports events. FYI re: food... They only carry various flavors of chips and peanuts - though you can order in from nearby restaurants... And, the staff here are super friendly in terms of clearing out the pizza boxes and such once you're done. I'm a fan.
author: Pina U.

description: This place has gone so down hill. It will still be popular because of the tvs, patio and with regulars who have been coming in for years but the staff is just awful. I used to go in there a couple of years ago and it was really fun and carefree. I stopped by a few times recently and just wow. The only bartender that had just a nasty personality then is now the main one. That's probably the problem but the rest of the staff is equally as bad. Well, the tall guy is great and door guy seemed cool but you name the bad trait and one of the bartenders have it. There's creepy, slow, inefficient and down right rude. It's like they hire people with zero experience and let them play bartender at the customers expense I don't know what direction the owners are taking but I just think they just don't care anymore.
author: Matt D.

description:
First time here last night.

First thought was why didn't I come here sooner?

Didn't expect the bar to be so big.

Pool tables, tons of seating, patio in the back and lots of TV along the wall especially two BIG screens.

The bartenders were super friendly and they are very generous with their alcohol.

Yesterday, my friends and I had 1 margarita, corona & rum/coke and it only came out to $16.50. Sweet.

Definitely will come again.

Thanks Joe (bartender!)
author: Carol Y.

description: Good service here with even better company. We even made a friend just sitting there drinking our beers. I was delighted to get a watermelon slice in my beer and so was my companion. The outside looked fun as well. Good bar as well. I'd definitely come back.
author: Erica K.

description:
Monday night trivia nights are the best! They run a really fun trivia program Monday nights, the host is hilarious and the winner gets bragging rights and a prize. They do standard question rounds, music, pictures, etc. 

My favorite thing about this bar is that they are open in the middle of the day. One day my friends and I just wanted to drink at 1pm after lunch and between Mucky Duck and Yancy's they were the only one open during the middle of the day! 


They have pool tables in the back and a few booths that can hold large groups. If you ever get hungry, you can duck out and get some shengkee or some pizza.
author: Christine B.

description:
agree with other commenter, bartender is cold and rude here. security is good
though, lots of bars in sf, doesn't stand out.
author: Liz L.

description:
Unnecessarily loud DJ music suitable for a dance club but,  not a bar.  One cannot hold a conversation. 

Otherwise... ok.
author: Jolly R.

description:
I have never experienced such awful customer service before. Not all of the bartenders are awful but the girl with the black hair and the man who wears glasses are very very rude. The whole night they both belittled me and my friend. We look young and they would not shut up about it. This would have been a complement if we were in our 40s but we're not. I ordered a drink from the guy and he said "are you sure I can't get you a juice box instead?" The girl preferred a more forward approach saying things like "I don't believe you're 21, you look like you're 14". I would have let it go if it was just those times but it was all night. It felt like they were teasing us and made us feel very uncomfortable. 

And their drinks are over priced.
author: Carissa W.

description:
FAVORITE place in the city!  Why??? Read on...

a) DOG FRIENDLY.  Do you know how nice it feels to be able to bring my little toy poodle, who is more well behaved then most men in this town, into a bar and have her feel welcomed and loved?  THANK YOU!

b) You can bring whatever food you like into this place.  Just clean up after yourselves your a-holes!  Don't leave your pizza boxes and napkins all over the place.  Respect.

c) Great bartenders.  Not in your face, but attentive.  I believe her name is Allison...she made me the best bloody mary I've ever had!  The girl has a passion, let her show you!  I just hope you like 'em hot and spicy!

d) Clean bathrooms...a MUST.

e) TONS of TVs.  Great for Giants, 49ers, and other Bay Area sports, but also great for Saturday college football.  One Saturday, I wanted to watch 3 or 4 different games, all teams from the East Coast.  And can you believe...they put alllllll of them on for me, on separate TVs next to each other.  Fantastic!  I felt like I was back home, watching all my favorite college teams.  It was great!

Thank you Blackthorn for being awesome!
author: Tara M.

description:
I'd like to give Blackthorn 2.5 stars- if only it were possible.

My boyfriend persuaded me into spending a night out with him and his buddies. They're a great gang and I had a wonderful time. 

At some point in the night it was suggested we venture up to Blackthorn. As I'd never been before, I was absolutely game for a new experience.

Blackthorn isn't anything special. It's a bar. It serves drinks. It's got some seating. I was surprised that we could snag a table for 5 at 11:30 p.m. at night with no problem. This shouldn't happen on a Friday night (but I'm certainly not complaining.)

The crowd was quite diverse- which isn't a negative or a positive. I was happy to get out of my Marina comfort zone. That being said, it didn't lend itself to conversing with others- and most groups kept to themselves. (Which, again, isn't a negative or a positive.) 

The bartender did lose my friend's debit card when he opened a tab. For a place that wasn't extremely busy- this seemed a little inexcusable. She did end up finding it. Later, the credit card machine wasn't working, and my friend waited FOR-EV-ER to pay his tab. I mean really? Get your sh*t together!

If you check-in at Yelp you get $3 off a pitcher of beer of your choice. This made the men quite happy!

Major Plus of Blackthorn: They've got quite a great mix of music. Where else can you find Bruno Mars, U2, Everclear, and Weezer all in the same place?

I've also been told the pool tables are kinda cool in the back- but we didn't venture too far beyond the front door.
author: Annalise F.

description: Good place to watch ufc fights boxing etc. very crowded and kinda muggy inside bc it was so packed. $10 cover per person for events. Good music and they played different kinds so caters to different types of people. Lots of lil restaurants nearby to eat before or after getting drunk.
author: Rebecca M.

description: My favorite pub.  Good Guinness pour, smoking area with heater and tv out back.  Good people and rarely any issues other then the occasional dog licking your hand while your trying to enjoy a pint out back.  A lot of good times here.
author: Michael D.

description:
Karaoke night was HILARIOUS. There were very few good singers... but after a few drinks, it's a party.

There are two pool tables at Blackthorn... which also includes the cult of hardcore regulars that bring their own sticks. Can be a pain trying to get a table.

There's also an outdoor room where folks can smoke and whatnot.

Plenty of tvs. Pretty good spot to watch a baseball or basketball game. 

Generally a young crowd. Not my type of bar, but I'll check it out if friends wanna go out to 9th & Irving.
author: Drea B.

description:
I should rate this higher, but I just don't like Blackthorn that much.  It has booths, which is really nice, and it surprisingly plays my type of music.  There are lots of TVs to watch sports--I'm not much of a sports fan though.

It`s also really loud.  I guess I was unhappy about this bar because it took me SO LONG to get drinks.  Each time we finished a round and somebody got up to get our next round, there would be a long wait..and since it was so loud..it's not like you can talk. 

Most of my friends go to Yancy's--which I'm also not a huge fan of, but they give you popcorn and they have dartboards.  I guess the crowd of people is just different.  The vibe is just not really what I enjoy.  I much rather go to Fireside.
author: Aly A.

description: Great bartenders and the regulars are really really good looking and friendly. I love the back patio-they have heat lamps so you don't get chilly. Def a good sports bar to come and watch any game. They have like 20 TVs.
author: Anastasia P.

description: You'll pretty much find me here at least 3 times a week. I come here for the bartenders, they're great and always make sure you're well lubricated even when crowded.
author: Nic B.

description:
Blackthorn is my favorite bar in the city. It's just so comfortable, I felt at home right away. 

They have big tables for groups, it's never tooo crowded (if it's not a game night), and Monday trivia and Tuesday karaoke are great. 

Protip: Paxti's pizza next door will deliver to the bar :)
author: Lauren P.

description: The ambiance is awesome and a high energy bar.  The Barnet is super friendly and really good at mixing drinks.  We visited to watch the playoff games and have been very satisfied with our experience.  An added bonus is that it is within walking distance of where we are staying.
author: Kim-Joe S.

description: Quite good bar except the bartender doesn't know how to count or, worst, try to steal you. Today, they successed.... -$10.
author: Sebastien B.

description: The bar has a good layout. There's decent beer on tap, as well as pool in the back of the bar. When it comes to the Inner Sunset, this is a good bar, but if I can go anywhere in San Francisco, it wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Brandon B.

description: A decent bar in the Inner Sunset. The bartenders are pretty nice, and the clientele isn't too unsavory. Drinks are a tad expensive, but you know where you're at.
author: Danny C.

description: Great pool tables and nice patio out back.
author: Miles C.

description: Great location, I live 2 blocks away, great bartenders, great service and drinks, lots of TVs, but the music is always too F*CKING loud!!!!! Really? Don't people converse anymore?!!!!
author: Monica W.

description:
I have to say, I'm kind of disappointed with this bar. When I first heard about it, I was expecting a more relaxed kind of ambiance and just the name, it's completely goth, yet this is some sort of sports bar! I really don't like that. There's already Mucky Duck down the street and Yancy's Saloon. Maybe I'm just too goth for this place?

But what does make it goth is that they have a smoking room in the back! (I'm seriously trying to find some hidden goth to this bar...heh) 

Overall, the bar has a nice beer selection, it is huge once you step in, it has TVs all over the place, but I find the crowds to be either a mix of 40's-20's, jocks, singles, groups of friends, and just all over the place. 

Blackthorn, I think you need to define yourself.
author: Alexia R.

description:
Was there last night to watch the first Giants / Reds game with two of my kids. It was PACKED. Remember in Uncle Buck when John Candy went to the house party and was trying to move through the crowd? That is how packed it was.

Being 55, I had to be the oldest one there but it was still fun. Just your normal neighborhood people that either ignored me or were pleasant to talk to/interact with. Hipster doofus (doofii?) can go somewhere else. It was loud but you could still talk and that the bar gave out SFGiants rally towels was cool.

Having wait staff is a definite PLUS. The bar was four to five deep and it was great to not have to wade through the masses to get a drink. Also, being able to go get a pizza and bring it in with us was good.

Would give it five stars if they could make it just a bit cooler inside. They had both the front and back doors open and every once in a while a cool breeze would waft through but it was a bit warm.
author: Mike G.

description: I went here during my FUNEMPLOYMENT phase in 2011 with a good college buddy of mine a few summers ago.  I went here in the afternoon during happy hour.  We were the only ones inside except for the bartender, another staff member, and man's best friend.  This place is pretty cool--and they got a pool table too!
author: Sam K.

description:
The Blackthorn is an awesome neighborhood bar. Great people frequent the place and just about every night is filled with laughter and good times. While the regular music they play isn't really up my alley some nights, the live bands they bring in are always great. There's also two pool tables and a really challenging group of regular players who put my game to shame. And of course there's the Medieval Madness pinball table, if you're into that.

All that said, I end up spending most of the time in the back patio area, which has proven to be an excellent spot to meet people since I was new to the neighborhood. The staff are also really friendly and do a great job of keeping the drinks flowing and the good times rolling. Having frequented the place for the last few months, it feels like I have an extended family at the Thorn. Keep up the good work, guys!
author: Chris V.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar. They have pool tables and I've heard that they have bar trivia at times during the week. They have a better than average whiskey selection, though there is some work needed in that area. The staff I met are all really helpful. This is a much better than average bar in the city.
author: Robert H.

description:
How can you write a bad review about this place. The people are great. The bar staff is attentive and they poor a good drink. There are areas of this spacious bar where you can have a good conversation with someone you know very well or with a complete stranger. The restrooms are clean and tidy. This place does not smell and is very well kept.

I host karaoke on Tuesday nights here. There is even a little dancing on this karaoke night. This is one of the best places I've ever worked with. This bar is respectful towards their neighbors. The owner goes to great lengths to keep people happy. 

There are menus by the wall where you can order food to be delivered or you can bring in your own food from other restaurants if you wish. There are two well-kept pool tables, a fairly large open patio, photo booth and pinball machine and ev*en darts (I believe). 

Well if you're a dart fan you can always give this venue a call to check.
author: Kenneth F.

description: Pretty cool semi-divey sports bar. When I've visited, there has always been a table available and a good beer selection. Will go back.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Joe and the staff at Blackthorn welcomed our large group party yesterday afternoon!  We had a lot of heavy drinkers in from Seattle for the Sounders game.  They were courteous and the service was good for the size of our group (~60 people).  There was a pool table and clean bathrooms.  Lots of flat screen TVs showing soccer games.  The smoking patio outback was nice too.

Will definitely be heading back!

I only rated it 4 stars because Blackthorn doesn't serve food - but they allowed us to bring in food from neighboring restaurants!
author: Suzi S.

description:
I like Blackthorn because:

Trivia night is really fun
Dog friendly
Pear cider on tap
Guinness beer comes with a four leaf clover on foam
Super friendly bartenders
In my hood
Pool tables in back
Looks cool from outside
Very mixed crowd

Definitely a good little neighborhood bar!
author: Sonya D.

description:
Cool place to watch sports if you happen to be in this neighborhood.  We caught the fight here Sat pm after dinner.  Glad we did too, it was fun and I'm not a UFC fan.  Guess I'm being converted to one.

I caught a Giants game earlier this year here with a friend and I remembered something that was reconfirmed this weekend: Blackthorn has GREAT bartenders. Those men are on seriously on their game. One even offered me literally the last seat in the house.  How very kind.... stuff you don't expect but I appreciate little things like that.
very cool neighborhood vibe to boot...

Also, love that it's a dog friendly bar.
author: Athena S.

description: Even though it's a little, ummm "douchy" for my taste, I have to say it can be pretty cool sometimes. The bartenders are awesome every time I've been there. Very attentive and friendly. Nice pours. They have karaoke on Tuesdays which can be fun if it's one I those nights. And the karaoke dj is pretty awesome. There's a pool table in the back as well as an inside smoking patio. The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is because of the immature crowd it attracts a lot of the time. But then again, it's not really their fault.
author: Lizz M.

description:
If I am in the Inner Sunset and need of a drink I will most likely hit up the Blackthorn.
They have an open air patio (which is rare in San Francisco) and they are dog friendly. (My cat Asha would not like it as she does not share my approval of dogs) 
Good selection of beer at a good price and they are cool with bringing in food stuff.
author: Marcus R.

description: Fun place to go watch the games. They have pool tables, TVs and outdoor seating. Definitely a fun local bar.
author: Gabriella T.

description: Great sports bar in the inner sunset. Great place to watch a game and grab a drink. Prices are treasonable and bartenders are very attentive!! Lots of seating and plenty of TVs to watch the games. They got 2 pool tables and a small arcade. I also noticed a small arcade which was really beat. It's usually packed there on game day but it's fun!! I will definitely be back!!
author: Daniel S.

description:
I HAD been a regular of this place for about the last year. I enjoyed my local dive bar after a rough days work and the new management seemed to be making some nice improvements to the place adding new TVs and such. Also, the other regulars were always friendly and cool people to shoot the s*** with.

So why the bad review? 

Recently it has started to become filled with drama. Suddenly my favorite local dive became like my crappy past jobs, rife with workplace politics. I'm not sure about any of you but I don't enjoy overhearing the management bicker/talk junk about staff in the open near patrons. I came here to get away from that crap, so be professional adults and work that out behind closed doors!

To make things worse, apparently my favorite blackthorn bartender, Nickole, was recently let go. Looks like she also was a casualty of the recent dramatic influx. Too bad bc she made some very good and unique drinks

And for those reasons, I'm going to find a new local dive to hit up after those rough workdays.
author: I N.

description:
I'm not really sure when Joe started grilling steaks on monday nights, but bless the man.

My buddy and i just found out this week, and this is pretty much our monday nights from here on out. $10 gets you a hefty cut of steak, potatoes, and some salad, plus a drink ticket (beer for $1? Hell Yes). To recap (1pm-7pm):

happy hour
free pool
free wifi
steaks start around 5

Then trivia starts at 9. Rad.
author: Phuong M.

description:
Happened to drop by after dinner on Monday nearby by.  Didn't even realize it was a sports bar until we walked in.  Very casual, lots of TVs.

Pretty good liquor selection, including scotch and whiskey.

But what made this place cool was it just happened to be Trivia Night ... and the guy leading it was the same guy from Mad Dog in the Fog in the Haight, where we used to go for trivia.

Fun scene.  We missed 1st place by a point among the small group (4 or less ppl) .. but we'll start recruiting and  work on it for next time b/c I think we'll be back!
author: F. P.

description: Currently here enjoying their happy hour ($1 off drafts = $3.50 Stella) and free wifi while waiting for my lovely husband to get off work.  Nice vibe, friendly staff, and doggies roaming around like it's the best dog park ever.  Also features 11 TVs, 2 coin-operated pool tables, and a few arcade games towards the back.  I've been here for almost 2 hours, and have another 3+ hours to go before trivia night begins.... and I spent a few hours here yesterday for hubby's birthday... so I guess I kind of like this place.  =o)
author: Anna C.

description:
Blackthorn is one of only two (Hooters is the other) places to watch UFC. It's a good location for watching UFC, but gets crowded early.

I arrived at 7:45 to watch UFC 126. There were several places to sit, but all seats were taken - standing-room only. They had a pretty good beer selection, and the crowd wasn't the usual TapOut-wearing douches. Standing the entire time was rough. If you're coming here to watch the fights, arrive before 7 p.m.

This is a cool venue to watch the fights, but, again, arrive early.
author: Michael C.

description:
The Blackthorn represents the ideal of the best bar ever.

How do I know this?

Because I've been going to the Blackthorn in one form or another for ten years. My original reason? They were the only bar in the 'hood that took credit cards.

But then my appreciation expanded. First, because the folks running the place had true Irish music. Then, under a new owner they cleared out the violent drunks and they had the best trivia, which the N Judah Chronilces kicked ass at.

But now, the bar is even better.More seating. A better barbecue on Mondays before trivia (done honestly btw) and best of all, the bar continues a world class improvement that doesn't make it a "yuppie bar" but makes it a bar EVERYONE loves.

Now, I write the N Judah Chronicles, and  I do not dispense praise for laughs. This bar is well worth the trip to the Inner Funset and more importantly, worth ignoring troll comments about management. 

To review:

Steak Night FTW
Trivia Night FTW
Karaoke FTW
and

the Blackthorn FTW

and

Anonymous Trolls can SUCK IT!
author: Greg D.

description: Came on a Friday night to try a new place out. The bar had loud techno music playing . Bartender saw me and a friend sit at the bar and then instantly asked us what we wanted to drink. They promptly served us our drink and then followed up with us if we wanted another when we were nearing the bottom of our cups. Everyone at the bar seemed to be having a great time. I'd definitely come back again.
author: Eric M.

description: Best trivia in sunset!! Especially because our group won. And all after a great Monday night football game. Blackthorn has been stepping it up. Tons of tvs, amazing happy hour (during the game!!), and cider pitchers!  The bartenders were great, Henry was attentive and really nice, explaining new beers and whisky,  and the Irish woman (I never got her name) was awesome at letting this too drunk group know they were cut off. Yancy's never cuts off people and you end up with people drooling on you and yelling obnoxiously.  Oh, and I thought I saw someone use a groupon. ..wtf...awesome. We didnt play pool, but they have two tables in the rear of the bar.
author: Shannon D.

description:
Great dive bar.

Went for a quick drink with the roomies, and didn't realize they had awesome karaoke Tuesday nights.   Started with some 90s favorites, and then soon "I Can Show You the World" was being belted out by a drunk couple.

Date night, girls night, quick drink before you move on....works for everything.

Oh and there's a nice outdoor patio with heat lamps in the back!
author: Cassie B.

description: I have to add that they play great music here. One of the guys behind the bar counter took over the jukebox machine and they were playing one great 80s song right after another mixed in with various other great non-80s tracks. Plus the trivia night makes it a fun place to be at especially if you're like me, just waiting to get onto "Who Wants To Be A Millionaire" since I have that random knowledge lying around for the right trivia game.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
When someone works hard to improve a situation, it's my job to improve my review. So THANK YOU Blackthorn Tavern for addressing the flipcup situation during Sunday football. Now that the flipcup kids are outside, everyone inside is free to enjoy the 1pm games in "peace."

Seriously. SO MUCH BETTER. If you love watching the games at at bar, then I highly recommend you come here. Flat screen TVs, sound (for local games), chill vibe, doggies, super nice bartenders. I will be back every Sunday (unless the Niners are at home, in which case I'll be watching at Candlestick. That place doesn't even DESERVE a Yelp review. Horrible)

Thanks Blackthorn. xx.

Previous Review:

I've been watching NFL football on Sundays at The Blackthorn Tavern since they opened a few years ago. Unfortunately, this year, they sponsored a Sunday Kickball League so at 1 p.m. non-football watchers pour into the bar to *not watch football* and play flipcup. This wouldn't bother me except OMG, their screams. It's like being in a room with a bunch of angsty kindergarteners who are high on crack and kool-aid. I'm honestly shocked that with some of the piercing shrieks, the windows haven't shattered.

That's fine if Blackthorn wants to be more like a frat house than a football bar. I know it works for the kickball/flipcup players. Just sucks for those of us who were stoked to have a super chill, super friendly awesome bar that played all of the games.

(Still good for 10 a.m. games, so I think going forward, I'll do a Blackthorn/Yancey's combo.)

Also: they let you bring food and dogs in. (I don't want to ONLY be a bitch. There are still redeeming qualities!) Also, this review is only for NFL Sundays. Ok. Enough of me. :) GO NINERS!
author: daisy b.

description:
I dont know who Nicole is, and I dont really care.

While Outer Sunset is still WAY cooler than innner sunset, I thought this bar was badass. The bartender was laid back, and made my girl and I some very tasty drinks. The borderline hipster interior was really nice. And you know I love me some billiards. I will be comeing back, and the steaks better be as good as everyone says they are.

And for the record: totally not a dive bar.
author: Nelson S.

description: Tons of TV's, best place to watch any baseball/football games with the boys. Fully stocked bar, bar seats and a few booths.  Make sure to go early and grab a good seat.  Was here the other day to watch a football game, arrived 1 hour before the game and was lucky to snag the last booth. Love how they allow take out food. I can enjoy eating TO GO from all the good restaurants near by, while the boys watch the game. Drinks aren't overly expensive and they have $3 beer specials!!
author: Chanel L.

description:
We'd actually rate it a 3.5 if we could. The beer selection is decent and the service is pretty fast. If you're looking to watch a game, there are enormous TVs everywhere. It can get very packed during games and big matches. It's cool that they let people bring their dogs in.

It's a great place if you're into the sports bar scene.
author: Dante and Alleliah G.

description:
good happy hour from 12-7

had 2 drafts for 8.50 (not bad for the city)

friendly staff and clean bathroom :)

cute outdoor patio are
author: Elaine Y.

description: Pool tables, jukebox, lots of tvs. All the makings of a great sports bar. What really sets this place apart from other bars is the fact that they have a wait staff, which is awesome because the bar can get pretty busy so not having to get up to and wait for a drink is great. The drinks are good, you can bring food in, and even when it's busy it's never hard to find a seat.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
I went there for my birthday last night and the crowd was friendly and wonderful.  This is after a couple of drinks in my system so I was having a more awesome time.  The music was great and it was also karaoke night.  A man serenaded me to the like of "Groove is in the Heart" by Dee-Lite.  It made me very happy to be alive and well to experience that.

The bar accommodated about 16-20 of my friends that came in and out the entire night.  It was a little pricier than expected.  Pitchers were $17 which is really not terrible expensive but I've been to posher bars in LA and those were only $10-15 for the same pitchers.

All in all a great time especially since the DJ played "Birthday Sex" for me and 2 other friends with the same birthday.  This place cares which is why I'm a loyal patron.
author: Ashley I.

description: Great neighborhood bar. They have a couple of pool tables, and a nice outdoor patio area with a TV, so you don't miss any of the action while you're outside. They even allow dogs, which is great!
author: Pilan C.

description: Went with a huge group last Saturday and left almost unscathed. Drunk BF left his card. Had a great time. Cheap drinks and a pool table mean I cannot complain!
author: Madison O.

description:
This place is great! Reasonably priced beers, and a solid selection.

We hunkered down here to catch a Giants game late in the season and the atmosphere was phenomenal. Good seating, good people and fast service from the bar. To top it off it had a grounded feel but great screens for the sporting event. I'll be returning.
author: Jordan W.

description:
So I like Blackthorn - I have lived in this neighborhood for quite some time and would pop into this place for a quick beer when doing laundry down the street.

I never made a point to come into this place at any other time until my husband and I became fans of Saturday Breakfast Cocktails with Nickole the bartender. Then I became a regular.

I am really bummed that they let her go - I mean really? A young, hot sober bartender getting the boot? Honestly, never heard of such a thing!

So I guess it is no more Saturdays for us at the Blackthorn. 

On to the Shamrock!!
author: Kate S.

description:
I love the Blackthorn Tavern for many reasons.

This is a great local bar with a nice selection of beer, good music and many interesting patrons.

A few times a week they have bands that play and on Thursday. It's usually a funk, rock, jazzy, reggae and soul band. They have room for dancing if you're in the mood and it's never too crowded. In the back of the bar they have two pool tables, a photo booth (FUN!) and a cozy out door patio. There are a few big screens in the bar so it's also a great place to watch a game (especially during the Giants extravaganza!). The bartenders are also friendly and very nice.

Great bar!
author: Denise S.

description: Great neighborhood bar that caters to the locals in particular. I love watching Giants and 49ers games here as it is one of the few places in San Francisco where the rule 'locals only' applies. I also love the fact that since they don't have a kitchen, they let you bring in outside food and don't make a stink about it like most places with a similar set-up that I have been to in the past. They have a good amount of beers on tap, make their drinks pretty strong and it's a great place to hang out without having to go outside of my hood.
author: Jared C.

description: Super fun place went on a Tuesday night who would have known how fun we had. The place was busy we had a great time people where doing karaoke. Great time check it out Definitely!
author: Brittany S.

description: If you want to play pool, go here. They have two pool tables and on weekdays you can usually win the table for a group. The ambiance is more modern than other bars around the area and they have an awesome outdoor patio with seating and stand-up heaters. A great place for large groups. I recently went with a larger group and the bar happened to be giving out free shots, so that was pretty awesome. Definitely a regular spot for me.
author: Lauren K.

description:
This place is kinda ok for to watch a game and chill with that sort of neighbourhood sports bar vibe. I just moved to the neighborhood, so was looking for a good hangout spot. Still a couple of other bars to try around here. So, we'll see. My beer was a little flat, I thought, and the guy changed it, but it wan't much better, really. I think he should have maybe tasted it, but maybe it was just the day that was. You know how that goes.

I'll try  it again and see if the beer's better next time. If so - I'll up my rating to 4 stars, cuz i did like the place and the staff otherwise.
author: Kevin M.

description: Love this spot for watching sport games. They have about twenty tvs. Big enough space so it's perfect to maneuver around. Great for big groups. One of the best spots to meet native san Franciscans. The also have a small back patio for smokers and a tv back there so you won't miss any plays in the game you are watching.
author: M H.

description:
Disclosure: I don't drink. Never have. But I love this bar.

If you are a soccer/football fan like me, you have very few choices in this country (although it is getting better). 

Most times you end up in some sports bar where all of the TVs are playing some useless sport (baseball, for example) and the world's greatest sport--the real football, the beautiful game--is relegated to a TV that looks like the size of those TVs on JetBlue. 

Not at Blackthorn. I came to watch Bayern Munich lose to, well, Bayern Munich in the Champions league and the game was on every TV. Nice and big, in HD. Droga's face in 60 inches of HD glory. As it should be. 

They don't serve food here. Another reason to love the place. You can bring outside food and order a soda. Or a beer. Or whatever your poison is. And in this great state of California, if you order a regular Coke, no weirdo governor like Bloomberg will try to tax you.

I will be back at this place next weekend and every weekend after to watch Spain win the Euros again.
author: George J.

description: This place is awesome, chill happy people that are down to hangout after work at ease. Dogs are welcome, and very friendly. The bartenders are awesome and hook it up! 13 TVs so tons of sports watchin'. It's a sports bar people, it's goin' to get loud occasionally during hour peaks, get over it.
author: Julia D.

description:
I revisited the Blackthorn for the Cloud-Johnson/Alexander-Kotelnik doubleheader on HBO.  One of the owners had offered me a free pitcher to come back and reconsider my initial review.

This time, the fights were on when I arrived, and every screen in the house was showing them.  I enjoyed the fact that they have some nice screens in this joint.

I watched the fights with a couple friends of mine, and enjoyed some Boddington's.
