Seeing as how this is the closest place that shows the fights, I will probably come back here in the future.  Hopefully, the crowds will pick up a bit when I do.
author: Gopal R.

description: Great place to chill and play pool, bartender was super friendly and told me about the best places for certain drinks.
author: D R.

description: A great sports bar! I love the booths. I accidentally spilled my beer at the bar and the bartender gave a free one, that was really sweet of her. Thank you kind bartender :)
author: Alicia K.

description:
A bar in transition, yes. 

Does it suck like others have noted, no.

They are doing a lot of good work on upgrading the bar, the booze and other selections. 

I look forward to the changes and am glad they have some of the staff retained from Bobby's Blackthorn.

A fun local Diveesque local in the IS - worth a bevie or four!
author: Joe Bob J.

description: Fun bar with a good atmosphere! Came here to watch UFC with some friends a few weeks ago and was impressed. The cover charge was about $5 less than at Silver-Cloud on fight nights, which translates to more money for drinks! Lots of viewing screens and bartenders who were quick to jump on the switch from the network broadcast of Spiderman to the main fight card once it started. Also, they've got a menu of local eateries up at the bar that you can peruse through to order in, which was pretty convenient. A bartender even lassoed us up when our food arrived so we could lay claim to it. I've had stronger drinks elsewhere, but after throwing down an extra couple bucks the next two rounds were pretty stiff. I hear they've got karaoke here some nights, too, gonna have to make it back here to check that out!
author: Tessa M.

description:
I for one like the New changes. As for prices, I drink at all the bars in the hood & the Blackthorn has hands down the cheapest drink prioces around.
$10 for two drinks on a Sat or Sun evening is cheap concidering they server Guinness in a 20oz imperial pint, its $6 in most Irish bars for a pint of the black stuff.
As for the fights, I'm a huge fan & no one should complain about viewing a Pay per view event when they don't charge you like Every single other spoorts bar that shows fight do, minimum $10 to $20!!!

 The bar is cleaner, the smells gone, extra pool tabe & they even got a pinball machine in Woot, fan freaking tastic.

Someone says they dont like the patio anymore? WHY?
They put a NEW awning in, a heat lamp, its been cleaned up & they even put some plants out there, whats not to like about it?

The DJ still plays every Friday night, great band on Thursday night, Trivia is back, finally & Kareoke is still there.
In fact not much has changed in that respect its actually gotten better.
Same bar tenders with the addition of a few more I have yet to get to know but I'm sure I will.

Also they install 12 new Flat screens so I know where I'm going for monday night & Sunday Football. I hope Joes is still going to do the fre BBQ but since I saw a new Big Red BBQ out the back I think they will.

All in all I'm quite happy with the New owners, they've cleaned the place up & kept the local feel to the place.

Best New bar in the Hood.
author: Jack H.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend and friends and to be honest, I felt displaced upon walking in. Has it ever happend where you walk into a room and everyone just stares at you because you don't "blend in". Well it didn't happen, but I still felt displaced for some reason. Strange how you can grow up in a diverse city and still be uncomfortable with people outside your own ethnicity. 

We met a friend here with his friends and I was glad that just within the first 5 minutes, I began to feel more at ease. The crowd was very friendly and we no longer felt like the elephant in the room. The bartenders were actually really friendly too. I liked how mellow the place was and yes I know its a bar but I'm more used to places that are loud and filled with obnoxious drunkards. 

The back had a pool table also and another room that I didn't get the chance to see. I'd love to come back :]
author: Connie C.

description: Good-sized back patio + tap beer menu. I'm a fan! My plan is to stop by for Monday trivia next.
author: Randy M.

description:
Nice. Not a dive bar. Dog friendly and accepts credit cards, plus and plus. The staff is friendly and there was a nice diversity of patrons who did not do the "why the hell are YOU in my bar" stare when you walk in! I will have to go back to try some steaks and trivia. But for the meantime I'm always happy to find a bar that is clean, has a nice environment, and has room to find a table with some friends. 

P.S.  I hate cigarette smoke, and this is a for real NO SMOKING bar : )
author: Kristen E.

description:
I'm writing in response to daisy b's original review.

She clearly has a stick up her ass, most of her reviews are negative.
I've been going to blackthorn for many years even back when it was a super Irish bar. This place has always been a party...a friendly staff who remember you and your order, cheap booze, good times. 

Also to address these flip cup games:
Do you not like having fun? Flip cup makes everything better and the kickballers seem like friendly people who like to have fun.
Most of them were watching and cheering for the 49er's along with the rest of us.

So if you're looking for a good time come to the blackthorn, if you're looking for a superchill place to watch sports, go to applebees.
author: Jay S.

description:
this place is kind of weird! so they don't serve any food - only alcohol. but you can bring in any food you want from outside, or even have pizza delivered.

i'm not against that idea. it just makes things kind of chaotic. and if you're going to just do drinks, please do it well. all the beers on tap tasted weird and watered down. i must have finished half a pitcher and was not even buzzed in the slightest. and my beer tasted shitty. that's unacceptable. 

pluses: they did accommodate the yelp check-in deal, service was nice, lots of screens for watching sports.
author: lily c.

description: A much better pick than Yancy's. There are pool tables but they're always fun. Reasonable prices on drinks but can get quite busy on the weekends. All around great neighborhood bar and right next to the N Line.
author: M S.

description: This place is loud and you have to shout to hold a conversation.  But the liquor is a good price.  It is dark so you get a good sense of privacy.
author: Byron L.

description: My favorite bar!!!  I'm there at least once a week for trivia on Monday nights...cheap drinks plenty of TVs to watch any sporting event on overall awesome!
author: Ben S.

description: This is a great spot to watch sports, play pool, or meet with friends!  Great laid back vibe with friendly bar tenders.  The Mr. and I will definitely return!
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Love this bar! Super friendly staff, they have pool tables, great beers on tap as well as a full bar, and you can bring in any food you want to munch on, even get it delivered! They also bring in excellent music, last night local band Dirty Boots rocked the night closing with fun covers! The owner David was really helpful in allowing us to have our team fundraiser there and all the bartenders were helpful and really accommodating!
author: Gretchen K.

description: Came here after my work christmas dinner, our boss decided to not go in which was a good thing. It's a cute place, they have a good selection of booz and staff is really friendly. ( for what I can remember) They have a few booths a good crowd can sit in. There is a nice patio in the back which is heated but it's usually a cloud full of smoke so if your there on the weekend and want fresh air, go to the front. Otherwise stop by and have a drink.
author: Lana K.

description: Great spot to see pay per view,staff is on point plus a patio for smoking!!
author: Jessie B.

description: There's pool tables and they always have games on their flatscreens. Drinks are at an okay price. Not too expensive. My girlfriends and I came in after going to another bar but left early because there was a bunch of old guys that were being creeper status that would not leave us alone. Can these middle-aged guys not come to bars and look for young gold-diggers? You are not that attractive and act like a fool hitting on girls that could be your daughters. Thanks.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: This spot is chill. I liked to go bar hopping in the Sunset when I used to live in the area. I would usually just end up here. I watched a fight here once (don't ask me who because it wasn't my idea haha) but we paid five bucks to get in and stood because it was so packed. I used to be a smoker, so the back patio was cool to sit and chat. People who go here are usually very nice because they are regulars. They aren't stuck up. They have 2 pool tables here which are fun, even though I don't know how to play. I've met more than a handful of people here and are now my friends. Also, I Kareoke Tuesdays, but I never got a chance to go. I wouldn't recommend this place to a bougie person bc it's just a dive.. but a clean dive. :)  Somewhere to just chill and wear chill clothes. After dinner, if you didn't feel like going home yet, you can come here for a drink or 2. PS. They accept card! That's always a plus here in the city.
author: Jamie B.

description: Nice neighborhood bar with friendly bartenders and good selection of whiskeys and other liquors. Monday night trivia is a whole lot of fun.
author: E L.

description: came here on a sunny sunday afternoon with some friends.  we had a walk through the park to 9th and irving and decided to sit down for a drink. Walked in, smelled like urine! eehhkkk.....there is a little backyard where you can sit and drink which was boring cuz there were no music or TV. Got up to use the bathroom, omg, toilet was flooded and the smell was sooo bad. yuck, wont be coming back here again.
author: Alyce l.

description: I LOVE this place so much. I come from Daly city to go to this bar. The atmosphere here is great and the bartender Tommy is awesome. HINT HINT, they make better drinks then the bars down the street and are usually $1.00 or more less
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Came here to watch UFC 137. None of my other friends are MMA fans, so I figure I pay $10 here instead of $59 at home for the PPV. With the admission, I also get a drink ticket.

The crowd was lively, but no meatheads. The dude next to me, Ryan, was knowledgable of the sport, so we had good chats about the fights. As the night went on, we made friendly bets with other patrons for drinks. It was a night of combat sport amongst a very chilled crowd.

I'll definitely be back for big fights.
author: Gary S.

description:
Great bar!  Joe the bartender is bad ass.  He is such a nice guy.  Lots of tables and bar stools to watch any of the games on the many tvs they have.  Great place that coworkers and I frequent after work during the week.  It is 'our' bar.  

Great array of drinks, Two pool tables in the back.  Also a back porch you can sit outside and enjoy the weather and a beer.  :)  It is Dog friendly- so at any given time, there will be a dog walking around saying hi to everyone.  

I recommend this bar to anyone. Blackthorn rules!  :)
author: Natalie G.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the city.
GREAT beer selection.
TV's line the walls, great for sports and UFC.
Bartenders are AWESOME.
author: N O.

description: Went here on Monday for trivia. I rather liked the atmosphere, and while the only alcohol I really know anything about is Scotch, their selection was impressive. Definitely a clear step above a typical American bar. Quite a drive from where I live, but I'll come back for trivia time and time again.
author: Andrew M.

description: Blackthorn gets it right. The staff is friendly and pours a great drinks. The manager on down thru the bartenders understand customer service.
author: Big Leprechaun Moving A.

description: Haven't been here in a while- but it is a great cozy place to grab a pint when in the inner sunset...
author: Jim B.

description: Bar tenders are awesome, karaoke is fun, kick back atmosphere. You can bring food from a plethora of different restaurants that the inner sunset has to offer to the bar! What more can you ask for?
author: Alton P.

description: What the f***? How does a great bartender like Nickole get fired? It was the only reason I went to this bar. Her drinks were tasty and always very friendly. Too bad-guess I'm going to take my business elsewhere.
author: Karen C.

description: Always a fan of cheap drinks, chill atmosphere, and friendyl staff. Open smoking patio in the back which has tables and heat lamps when needed.  space has two pool tables for friendly games, but I know they also host tournaments there as well. I personally like going there when it's baseball season or PPV fights. get there early or you won't have a seat!
author: April C.

description: This bar is fun as hell, in my opinion one of the best bar's in sf. I recomend this place all the time it's got a great atmosphere and good people. It's too bad some of the reviews on here seem more personal then honest opinions. Don't believe the hype! the blackthorn is awesome
author: matthew w.

description: This is just an overall fun bar with a cool vibe.  I don't know how to describe it exactly.  It has a mix of people from indie chicks to white dudes with dreads to american apparel junkies to just neighborhood folks with their barking papillon hiding under the pool table.  The drinks were tasty and strong at an affordable price, and you can find plenty of entertainment in either the pool tables, a golf game, pinball, or the photobooth.
author: Madison M.

description:
I always assumed that the mission of every irish pub is to enable people throughout the world to realize their full drinking potential. Since the beginning of the 1500's they've striven hard to achieve this mission. 

Blackthorn is no exception to the rule. This is a friendly inner sunset bar and you couldn't get in trouble here even if you wanted to. All the patrons are friendly and bringing the energy is what they're good at doing.

There's a dance floor here. There's an outside patio here where bbq's take place. There's trivia nights.

Come by to Blackthorn Tavern where the fun never stops.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: This was a surprise find on the way back from our trip to Ocean Beach.   We found friendly service, reasonable prices, a decent level of sympathy for stranded tourists and what struck us as a great mid-Monday sense of fun.  The fact that it was our vacation was well known....the fact that we could enjoy an afternoon of truancy at a discount rate is just outstanding.
author: Ali S.

description: Great facelift remodell, great bar and Kaitlin's bloodies are awesome. Definitely the bar to hang at for the local feel when you're in the inner sunset.
author: Mark B.

description: Its the place to be on Wednesday nights!!! Tommy is a great bartender we always have such a great time!! xo xo
author: Tanya O.

description: Pretty solid neighborhood bar with a pleasant atmosphere: chill but not dive-y, never gets crowded, friendly staff. You can bring or order your own food from one of the neighboring restaurants (a plus, considering the wealth of good food in the neighborhood). Quiet and polite clientele. Always seems to be a pool table free AND there's no-wait Karaoke on Tuesday (awesome).
author: Catherine T.

description: Local bar. Good for a local crowd that doesn't mind questionable cleanliness and crap parking. Maybe the bar staff is friendlier to regulars? It also irked me that with the Irish pretense and the half dozen televisions you'd think that they'd have a more international eye towards sports, but no such luck.
author: Michael B.

description: Great place to watch a game. Rivals Yancy's up the street but beats them out cause they take card considering you get raped with ATM fees up and down Irving. The bartenders are friendly and it's got a good all around good, casual atmosphere.
author: Michael L.

description: This is a great local bar with lots of room and fairly priced drinks. Came here to see a friend's band play and had a pretty good time. Free music is always a plus. They have pool tables and a big outdoor patio area. Giants stuff all over, so its good in my book!
author: Stephanie W.

description: I used to come here back in the days, college days that is, like almost 10 years ago days, damn I'm getting old!..Last night went early and got prime seating next to the huge flat screen and line of smaller TVs lined up in front of me. Who needs to be at AT&T Park when you can watch the World Series with crazy loud fun GIANTS fans at Blackthorn! It was an amazing game and an amazing night. The energy awesome, bartenders were amazing! got all my drinks fast even with crazy crowd. They were also very friendly. Oh and the only woman bartender, you made a really good margarita! BUENO!
author: Karen T.

description: Was here 7-28-11 10:30pm to watch jesus and the rabbis to perform.  Unexpectedly a great band to watch, they all definitely have talent.  They played old school to new school music,including some original material.  After the gig, I spoke with the bartender(I think his name is Jason--he's an alright individual, definitely appreciates my positive comments).
author: Jer W.

description: I just stumbled across this place looking for a new bar to watch the NFL season at.  They had everything I was looking for. They've go tons of TVs showing every game in HD. They have the volume turned up on the games and are serious about showing sports.  The jukebox was off, and the pool tables moved out of the way to accommodate viewers.  They bartender was fun and sharp as a tack.  They have free hot dogs and hamburgers all day Sunday.  The bloody mary's are good and stiff.  We even got comp'd a drink, and it was only our first visit. The place wasn't over-packed and the people there weren't crazy drunk, screaming and loud, but instead having fun and enjoying the games.  This is my bar to watch football in for the rest of the season, even if it means driving out the Inner Sunset.
author: Tom K.

description: Good beer offerings, outside patio, pool tables, and plenty of TV's. You can't go wrong! There is some construction going on in the mens bathroom, otherwise this would be a 5-star rating.
author: Daniel R.

description: My good-to place for UFC events. $10 cover. Good variety of booze. Place is understaffed, but decent service. Would go here again.
author: R L.

description: loved going and loved dealing with Nickole...just found out she's gone. which pretty much guarantees that so am I. when will these guys learn that bars are like hair salons...it's not the place it's the people in the place. Let us know where you land next Nickole.
author: Eugene R.

description: Great place to go and watch the game. One of my favorite bars in the area. I'd pick it over Yancey's for friendly atmosphere and service. And they know how to pour a Guinness at Blackthorn.
author: Melissa B.

description: the guinness could have come out a little colder.  service was average.  sucks that happy hour ends at 6pm, not 7pm.
author: Ethan L.

description: Let me enlighten you about this fine establishment known as Blackthorn. After a long day of obligations or what have you there is nothing like kicking back with some friends and having a drink or two, and there really isn't a better place than Blackthorn. Never once has it let me down, quick and very friendly service is found here and never once do you get vibed out by the workers, everyone is kind and seems stoked that you have brought your business here. As an added bonus they have a spacious back patio area where you can take your drink and enjoy a cigarette, always a plus to any scenario. So overall I would highly recommend this bar to anyone who is looking to have a good time, why go anywhere else when this place has everything you need!
author: Tysen R.

description: This is a pretty decent bar in the Inner Sunset.  Recently remodeled the entire inside and they have about 20 very nice HD TV's so it's great for football sundays.  I can't really complain about 3.50 bud lights and 4.50 tab beer but its certainly not as cheap as I'm used to.  Also you allowed to bring in your own food they even have menu's of places that deliver for free.  Finally dogs are allowed so if your out for a stroll its not a bad place to pop your head in.  However beware, if you find a hot girl in this bar pick her up and run because they are few and far between
author: Ryan B.

description: I've checked out BT a couple times and it seems pretty solid. One of my buddies has a band who played BT and they sounded awesome. The drinks were made proper and the joint has a bunch of Betties running around. Why more do you want??
author: Jeff B.

description: i wish this place was a little more divey and a little less meat market...additionally i want to blow up about every oversized television that swallows up every square inch  of this place with bright stupid-ass HD broadcasts and lastly, the jukebox makes me want to kill myself
author: B F.

description: the place is hit and miss with me.  i've been in there for ufc fights and had fun.  the female bartenders from ireland throw the small town attitude around.  they serve their friends first even if you have been waiting at the bar for a while.  the guys seem much cooler.  i went in during the day around 3pm and there was a bartender i've never seen before and we talked for an hour about bs guys stuff (girls, football, baseball).  it was pleasant.  they stopped letting dogs in which is a major plus for me.  they got busted by the health dept.  apparently, alcohol is considered food and dogs are not allowed in any place where they serve food.  one of the main negatives is the manager guy thinks he can smoke pot in back.  it blows in and everyone can smell it.  well mr. manager with the tats, some of us live in the real world and have to take drug tests for work and don't want to inhale the bud you are smoking.  do that shit at home or do you not care about your $30000 liquor license?
author: T D.
